decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to fill your graveyard quickly with cards like Hedron Crab, Stitcher's Supplier, and Memory Sluice in order to trigger powerful graveyard recursion effects like Vengevine, Bloodghast, Gravecrawler, and Prized Amalgam. By milling yourself and utilizing cards like Narcomoeba and Creeping Chill, you can quickly overwhelm your opponent with a swarm of creatures and deal massive damage. This deck aims to combo off and win in explosive fashion by utilizing the graveyard as a powerful resource.

This Gruul Utopia deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with Utopia Sprawl and Arbor Elf, while disrupting opponents with control elements like Magus of the Moon and Domri, Anarch of Bolas. Kiora, Behemoth Beckoner helps draw cards and ramp, while cards like Glorybringer and Bloodbraid Elf provide powerful threats. The deck aims to control the board early on and then overwhelm opponents with big creatures and burn spells. The combination of ramp, control, and threats makes this deck versatile and adaptable to a variety of matchups.

The main goal of this deck is to aggressively attack the opponent with fast and efficient creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, while also dealing direct damage with spells like Lava Spike and Lightning Bolt. The key strategy is to apply constant pressure on the opponent and force them to make quick decisions to try and survive. The inclusion of cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Skullcrack further punishes opponents for playing spells, making it difficult for them to stabilize and turn the game in their favor.

The deck focuses on using Infect creatures like Blighted Agent along with various pump spells like Mutagenic Growth and Vines of Vastwood to quickly defeat the opponent by dealing 10 poison counters. It also includes disruption cards like Force of Negation and Remand to protect the combo. Oko, Thief of Crowns provides additional utility and disruption. The mana base is optimized for consistency and includes cards like Elvish Reclaimer and Noble Hierarch for ramp. The deck aims to win the game quickly through a combination of infect damage and control elements.

This deck focuses on quick, efficient burn damage to swiftly defeat the opponent. Utilizing low-cost spells such as Searing Blaze, Skewer the Critics, and Lava Spike, combined with aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Goblin Guide, the strategy is to apply constant pressure and finish off the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive playstyle, allowing for consistent access to the necessary colors to cast spells and ensuring a fast, relentless assault on the opponent.

This deck focuses on quickly lowering your own life total to grow Death's Shadow while disrupting your opponent's game plan with hand disruption and removal spells. The deck aims to control the board by playing efficiently costed threats and disrupting your opponent's hand, all while setting up lethal attacks with Death's Shadow and Temur Battle Rage. The deck also utilizes Mishra's Bauble to draw cards and provide additional information. Overall, this deck is designed to be fast and aggressive, aiming to win the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on quickly developing a board presence with aggressive human creatures that benefit from each other's presence. By efficiently using cards like Champion of the Parish, Thalia's Lieutenant, and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and disruptive strategy. The inclusion of Aether Vial allows for creatures to be put into play at instant speed, providing flexibility and surprise tactics. Additionally, the deck utilizes a mix of lands that support the human creature type and provide mana fixing for the deck's multiple colored spells.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive goblin creatures that can quickly swarm the battlefield and overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing powerful goblin synergies and cheap spells, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The inclusion of cards like Goblin Chieftain and Goblin Warchief help boost the goblins' power and speed, while cards like Munitions Expert and Sling-Gang Lieutenant provide removal and extra damage. With the help of Aether Vial and efficient land base, this deck aims to outpace the opponent and secure a fast victory.

The main concept of this Modern 1 vs 1 Control - Smallpox deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by using cards like Inquisition of Kozilek, Thoughtseize, and Smallpox to remove key cards from their hand and board. This control deck also utilizes cards like Liliana of the Veil and Gideon, Ally of Zendikar to further disrupt the opponent and generate card advantage. Lingering Souls and Bloodghast provide a constant stream of threats while cards like Fatal Push and Collective Brutality help to deal with opposing threats. The deck also has a strong mana base with cards like Flagstones of Trokair and Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth to ensure smooth gameplay.

The deck focuses on assembling a combo with Devoted Druid and Vizier of Remedies to generate infinite mana and pump out a large Walking Ballista for the win. The Creatures Toolbox aspect allows for flexibility and consistency in finding the combo pieces or other important creatures like Eternal Witness for recursion or Knight of Autumn for disruption. The deck also includes powerful interaction and card advantage spells like Collected Company and Once Upon a Time to ensure a streamlined and efficient game plan.

The key concept of this deck is to establish board control and card advantage through counterspells, removal, and powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. The deck also utilizes efficient creatures like Spell Queller and Snapcaster Mage, along with equipment like Batterskull and Sword of Feast and Famine, to maintain pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan. With a strong mana base and versatile spells, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and grind out a win through control of the game.

This deck aims to control the game by using the UrzaTron lands to generate a significant advantage in mana. It includes powerful control spells like Condescend, Remand, and Supreme Will to disrupt the opponent's plans and protect your own threats. Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon provide additional control options while also presenting win conditions. The deck also has access to big threats like Emrakul, the Promised End and Wurmcoil Engine to finish off games. Overall, the key concept is to outvalue and outlast the opponent through efficient control and powerful threats.

This Aggro-Death and Taxes deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with creatures. By utilizing cards like Leonin Arbiter and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to slow down the opponent's mana development and spells, combined with Thought-Knot Seer and Tidehollow Sculler to strip away key cards from their hand, this deck aims to control the game and push through damage with efficient creatures like Flickerwisp and Eldrazi Displacer. Additionally, the deck can utilize Aether Vial for added versatility and tempo advantage.

The deck focuses on cycling creatures like Street Wraith and Horror of the Broken Lands to fill the graveyard quickly, then casting cascade spells like Violent Outburst and Demonic Dread to cascade into Living End and return all creatures from the graveyard to the battlefield. The deck also includes ways to disrupt the opponent's strategy, like Fulminator Mage and Beast Within, while also utilizing Archfiend of Ifnir to take advantage of discarding creatures. The key concept is to efficiently cycle through your deck and cheat powerful creatures into play with Living End.

The primary focus of this deck is to quickly build a strong board presence of Merfolk creatures through the use of cards like Aether Vial and Spreading Seas to disrupt the opponent's mana base. The Merfolk lords like Master of the Pearl Trident and Lord of Atlantis pump up all Merfolk creatures on the battlefield, making them even more threatening. Key interactions include using Merfolk Trickster to disrupt opponents' creatures and Harbinger of the Tides to tempo swing. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive Merfolk creatures backed up by disruption spells.

The deck revolves around utilizing Jeskai Ascendancy to generate infinite mana and draw cards by looping through cheap artifacts with Emry, Lurker of the Loch and other artifact creatures. This combo is further supported by cards like Mox Opal, Mox Amber, and Paradoxical Outcome. The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo pieces while controlling the board with cards like Engineered Explosives and Urza, Lord High Artificer. Saheeli, Sublime Artificer provides additional tokens for protection and to increase the combo's power.
